paragraphs.text: Mike is of the “new school” of winemakers — superbly trained in a technical sense, but also involved in every step of the winemaking process.

Like many good winemakers, he realizes that the quality of the grapes on the vine is the key to making good wine — ideas of his own that go beyond the laboratory measurements he learned so well at UC Davis.

Schug Carneros Estate Winery is situated on a 50-acre site in the Carneros Appellation, south-west of the town of Sonoma. Chardonnay vineyards surround the winery, while other grapes are bought in from highly respected and experienced growers.
This classic Carneros Chardonnay was grown on our own cool-climate Estate vineyard, as well as the Ricci, Cornerstone, Wildcat, Sangiacomo, Leveroni and Iund Vineyards.

The barrel regiment included fermentation and aging on the lees (“sur-lie”) in small French oak barrels, with minimal new oak introduced. Malo-lactic fermentation was not induced, allowing the wine to retain its natural acidity and varietal focus.

A wine that is both rich and powerful, while refreshing and elegant on the finish. It has a ripe, spicy tropical bouquet with flavors that suggest citrus, pear and spiced apples. Well-balanced acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish, making it an excellent wine with food.
Try it with cream soups, rich seafood, fowl, veal and pasta dishes.
